title: Ticket #4787: condor_q analysis misleading for negated clauses
description:
If a clause is negated, the output from condor_q analysis is misleading (correct, but misleading.)

For example, 

The Requirements expression for this slot reduces to these conditions:

       Clusters
Step    Matched  Condition
-----  --------  ---------
[1]           0  member(JobUniverse,OfflineUniverses)
[3]           1  IsValidCheckpointPlatform

slot3@tlmiller-laptop.cs.wisc.edu: Run analysis summary of 2 jobs.
    2 (100.00 %) match both slot and job requirements.
    2 match the requirements of this slot.
    2 have job requirements that match this slot.

Looks self-contradictory, until you scroll up and notice that 

    START is OfflineUniverses is undefined ||
    (  !member(JobUniverse,OfflineUniverses) )

It would be more user-friendly to output 

       Clusters
Step    Matched  Condition
-----  --------  ---------
[1]           1  ! member(JobUniverse,OfflineUniverses)
[3]           1  IsValidCheckpointPlatform

instead.
creator: tlmiller
